title: Augusta County: George Wils(?) to Writer's sister, March 18, 1861
summary: George chastises his sister for writing short letters and gossips about friends, acquaintances, and family. He also expresses his wish that Virginia would secede, proclaiming his southern allegiance and disparaging the "Black Republican party."
keywords: African Americans, Enlistment, Family, National Government, Patriotism, Race Relations, Slavery, State Government, Women, American Civil War
